item.description:
It's time for another series of FREE classical music concerts!

This evening's program features Boston Symphony Orchestra Assistant Conductor Julian Kuerti as he returns to conduct the NEC Philharmonia.

The NEC piano department's celebration of the Chopin bicentennial continues with a performance of Chopin's Piano Concerto No. 1 in E Minor, Op. 11. Lu Shen '11 M.M., a student of Alexander Korsantia, is the soloist.

Also on this program: Bartók and Stravinsky. These pieces are a little more modern and atonal than the
Chopin, but seem interesting on first listen (see below.) (To my ear, the Stravinsky has a lot in common with his Rite of Spring.) For more details about the concert, go to http://necmusic.edu/n...

The concert starts at 8pm, but let's meet up at 7:30, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize before the concert. Tonight I will try to sit either as high up on the left side of the main floor as possible or in the left-middle balcony section if it's open, since it affords a good view of the orchestra, and the pianist's hands.

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.


This evening's program will include:


  • Chopin's Piano Concerto No. 1 in E Minor, Op. 11 Listen here
  • Bartók's Music for Strings, Percussion and Celesta Listen to 2nd movement here
  • Stravinsky's Symphonies of Wind Instruments Listen here
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will join the group, either in the left section of the main floor or upstairs to the left-middle balcony section (if it's open.)
item.name: Classical Concert Series: Kuerti conducts Chopin, Bartok & Stravinsky
